meanings.definition: A twisting force that tends to cause rotation.
meanings.sent1: The torque of the windmill blades made them spin quickly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a wrench to apply torque to the bolt.
meanings.sent3: The torque of the tornado twisted everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: His words had a torque that turned the situation around.
meanings.sent5: The torque of the river currents sculpted the landscape over time.

meanings.definition: To twist or wrench with a torque.
meanings.sent1: She carefully torqued the lid of the jar to open it.
meanings.sent2: The athlete torques his body to generate more power in his swing.
meanings.sent3: He torqued the story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The dancer torqued her body gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic torqued the screws to secure the structure in place.
